drop

public void drop(int column)
          throws OutsideBoardException,
                 ColumnFullException
This method tries to put a piece at the first free square on the connect4 board counting from the bottom in the specified column.

Parameters:
piece - requires an object of the enumerator type Piece.
column - a integer value which is in range of the board width.
Throws:
OutsideBoardException - thrown from lower in the hierarchy.
ColumnFullException - if there is no free square in the specified column.

                    throws OutsideBoardException,
                           ColumnFullException
This Method gets the row where the piece has to be dropped

Parameters:
column -
Returns:
Throws:
OutsideBoardException
ColumnFullException

countEqualPiecesInOneDirection

public int countEqualPiecesInOneDirection(BinaryPiece piece,
                                          int i,
                                          int j)
Parameters:
piece - pieces of this kind will be counted.
i - row position of the last piece that was set plus vector i.
j - column position of the last piece that was set plus vector j.
Returns:
integer value of the number of pieces that have been found.

countEqualPiecesInOffDirections

public boolean countEqualPiecesInOffDirections(BinaryPiece piece,
                                               int i,
                                               int j)
Please read the description of nextDropAllowed() to understand what this method does. nextDropAllowed() is contained in de.hsaugsburg.games.boardgames.connectfour.ConnectFourEngine.

Parameters:
i - is the first coordinate of a vector
j - is the second coordinate of a vector
Returns:
true if the last dropped piece is in a row of four equal pieces
Throws:
BoardNotInitializedException - catches a system message from lower in the hierarchy and converts is to a user friendly message: "Please start a new game first!".

nextDropAllowed

public boolean nextDropAllowed(BinaryPiece piece)
This method checks if one of the players has four in a row and hence won the game. To do this it calls the countEqualPiecesInOffDirections() method which checks opposite directions and calls countEqualPiecesInOneDirection() in turn to do so. The method can be found in de.hsaugsburg.games.boardgames.connectfour.ConnectFourEngine.

Returns:
true if the last dropped piece is in a row of four equal pieces
Throws:
BoardNotInitializedException - is thrown from a class lower in the hierarchy

switchPiece

public void switchPiece()
                 throws SwitchNotAllowedException
Switch Piece is now completely defined in this class and not in the super-class!

Throws:
SwitchNotAllowedException - If the game is already finished a Exception is thrown if you try to add another piece to the board.
BoardNotInitializedException
BoardNotInitializedException - is thrown from a class lower in the hierarchy
